top_categories.workout_context: 204 miles. Your legs will beg to quit after 120. This trains the power output you need from mile 130 onward.
204 miles rewards fat oxidation. This volume work shifts your fuel mix so you're still burning fat at hour 5, not bonking at hour 3.
Every hard session works better with a bigger aerobic base. At 204 miles, base fitness is the difference between racing and surviving.
Coast to Coast's Gravel roads, Rural Michigan forces constant power changes. Surge over the rough stuff, settle on the smooth, repeat for 204 miles.
Race-pace efforts that mimic Coast to Coast's demands. Pacing, fueling, and tactical decisions under fatigue. Practice the race before June.
Endurance with intensity spikes baked in. Exactly what 5,000ft of climbing on Michigan gravel roads does to your power file on race day.
Coast to Coast's Michigan gravel roads rewards steady threshold power. Surging and recovering costs more watts than just holding.
5,000ft of climbing means repeated surges above threshold. VO2max work is how you survive the fifth climb, not just the first.
At Coast to Coast, surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding. Over-unders train exactly that.
Tempo is Coast to Coast's race pace. The wattage you'll hold for 204 miles on Michigan gravel roads. Train it until it's automatic.
88–92% FTP is where you'll spend the hardest sustained miles of Coast to Coast. Train it until it feels boring.
How long can you hold 105% FTP before you blow? At Coast to Coast, that number decides whether you bridge or get dropped.

race_overlay.nutrition: Ultra-distance fueling for 204 miles: 80–100g carbs/hour from mile 1 — don’t wait until you’re hungry. Practice your exact race-day nutrition in every long training ride. Carry backup calories. 204 miles burns 8,000–12,000+ calories — you cannot replace them all, but you must try.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at Coast to Coast requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on michigan gravel roads to build confidence. Expect: gravel roads, rural michigan, rolling terrain.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on Durability, HVLI Extended, and Endurance to prepare you for 204 miles of michigan gravel roads in Au Gres to Ludington, Michigan.
